name: Humata heterophylla
description: Humata heterophylla is an epiphytic fern native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly the Philippines, Malaysia, and Indonesia. It belongs to the Davalliaceae family and features trailing fronds (30-60 cm long) with medium-sized, dramatic, finely divided, dark green fronds with distinctive furry rhizomes. The plant displays a trailing growth habit. In its native habitat, it grows on tree branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant provides lush, feathery texture to any environment. It's popular among fern enthusiasts for its attractive fronds.
careTips: Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged
Avoid direct sunlight - prefers bright indirect light
Brown edges indicate low humidity or underwatering
